question: You are something else.
answer: Come on -- stay. Just a little. We can talk, I'll get a pizza. Pizza in bed, we'll have fun. And you still haven't told me what happened. What did she say?

question: What did who say?
answer: Who? The other woman. Your wife.

question: You are so damn sexy.
answer: Vince...

question: How did I get so lucky? What is it now, five years we've been together? Who do I thank?
answer: Today was the deadline, Vince.

question: I want us to be together. Like people. Honest, decent people. In the eyes of God. Babe, today... I went to confession.
answer: You did what?

question: For the first time in I don't know how long. I wanted everything done right. Open and above board. I told Father Antonelli I was in love. I told him it was a special love, for all the ages.
answer: You said that? And what did he say? Did he say you could leave her? Did he say we'd be happy?

question: He said that if I got a divorce I'd burn in Hell. For all eternity.
answer: What?

question: You want me to go against a priest? Get excommunicated? You think I'm nuts?
answer: You bastard!

question: We can still see each other. Just like always. It's a different kind of sin. Smaller.
answer: You pig!

question: Babe, it's not me! I love you! It's God!
answer: You lying sleazeball! The best years of my life! What am I, garbage? Am I lint?

question: You're upset. I understand. I should go. I hate to.
answer: Get out of here! And never come back!

question: Oh, girls.
answer: Yes, Betty?

question: This prom is a real drag.
answer: Oh-huh.

question: Oh my!
answer: What is it, Betty?

question: Look at that. Get a gander.
answer: Oh my!

question: He's so dreamy. He's like... a Greek god. He's the cutest guy here. He's boss. He's fab. He's...
answer: Yes, Betty? D00-LANG, DOO-LANG, D00-LANG.

question: And where did it get me? I'm stuck in this rathole! You're holding me back, just like Vince! I should be headlining! What do you want? This is a private area! Get lost!
answer: You ain't got nothin' I ain't seen.

question: Then stop trying to memorize it. Hit the road.
answer: From Vince.

question: His ashes?
answer: With love.

question: From Vince? What a guy. Doo-lang, doo- lang.
answer: At least he's not a cop. At least he can afford a decent gift.

question: I used to buy.you,..stuff. On your birthday . When we were seeing each other.
answer: Yeah, like what? Quilted coat hangers, that your mother picked out? Lottery tickets? A travel iron?

question: So I don't shop.
answer: 'Cause you're always out, arresting people. Making trouble. I don't know why I went out with you in the first place, it was embarrassing! I couldn't hold my head up, I used to tell people you were a security guard!

question: Yeah, well, now, she goes out with a' better class of people. Vince Laflocca.
answer: He's a businessman.

question: A what? When are you qonna wake up?
answer: When are you gonna get off my case? Have you got a search warrant? What do you want -- cheap thrills?

question: Information, baby. I thought maybe somebody around here might have a conscience.
answer: Think again! And get out of here.

question: I'm going. My regards to Vince, And the Mrs. Ladies.
answer: That's it! I'm not taking it from him, and I'm not taking it from Vince! From now on, it's all about me! And if I can't spend it, drink it, or sleep with it -- it's gone. Like Sister Immaculata used to say, "Life is short, and then you fry." So long, girls -- see you in church!

question: Who else, Ernie? Who else was in on it? Why am I wasting my time?
answer: Won't need that anymore. Ta-ta.

question: Do it.
answer: Stuff this up your...

question: Babe. Christy. Is there a problem? With the coat?
answer: No... it's fine.

question: Yes?
answer: Thanks. A lot.

question: Is that why you came up here, Christy? To thank me?
answer: Sure.

question: And to say you're sorry. About this afternoon. And the things you said. Forgotten. Completely. Do you understand? Forgotten.
answer: Right. Yeah. Forgotten.

question: That's my girl. My girl in mink. Will you be home? Soon?
answer: Right. I'll be... at the apartment. Call me. Thanks. Again. Mink. Wow.

question: Ten flights?
answer: You'd lose. You'd die. All over the sidewalk. And into the street.

question: All right! I get the picture! I'll do it! I'll testify!
answer: Get a stenographer.

question: Okay, here's what I want. I know about this stuff. A five-star hotel. With room service.
answer: Maybe Hawaii.

question: Jesus, what do you think this is -- Wheel of Fortune? Let me spell it out for you. You have to hide like you don't even exist. You have to get so far hidden away that you never see sunlight.
answer: Okay -- no limo.

question: No nothing.
answer: What're you gonna do, put me in a bag and bury me?

question: I'm gonna put you in the last place on Earth that Vince would ever look for you.
answer: I hate you. I totally hate you.

question: Safest place in the world. You think Vince would look for you here?
answer: Nuns, Eddie. There are nuns here. Everywhere. It's crawling with 'em.

question: It's a convent. All you have to do is shut up, behave yourself, and get along.
answer: With nuns? With rulers? No way. I'm gonna go back, work things out with Vince.

question: Vince has put out a contract on you. A hundred grand. You've seen him in action.
answer: But... but Vince loves me. How could he... I mean, five years...

question: And one bullet. That's all it's gonna take.
answer: But Vince has contacts all over the place! This is San Francisco! They'll be looking for me!

question: Everywhere but this little hole-in-the- wall convent. Nobody knows you're here but me. We're trying to get a quick court date. A month, maybe two, tops. I'll spring you as soon as I can.
answer: I can't stay here! I'll crack up! Eddie, what am I gonna do?

question: Absolutely not. I am very sorry, but no.
answer: We can save this young woman's life, and imprison a parasite -- all in one gesture.

question: But she's been exposed to the underside of life. She is the underside of life.
answer: And therefore an ideal prospect for rehabilitation.

question: We're a small convent, Bishop. Surely there are... more appropriate shelters.
answer: Your small convent is in danger of closing, Reverend Mother. The Las Vegas Police Department has offered to make a generous financial donation.

question: But, Bishop...
answer: St. Katherine's is a Benedictine Order. You have taken a Vow of Hospitality. To all in need.

question: I lied.
answer: I know. Welcome, Lieutenant. Everything is in order.

question: A convent? They put me in a convent? What's the problem? Wasn't there any more room in Hell?
answer: What is your full name? Your Christian name?

question: Mother Theresa. Gandhi. Don't you understand? This is all a mistake. I'm the good guy. I'm the witness. And I'm being punished!
answer: Your name?

question: Christy. Christy Van Cartier.
answer: Enough joking.

question: That's my real name! Currently I'm a singer. Sort of.
answer: Very well.

question: Oh my God. This isn't happening, tell me this isn't happening. It's a nightmare, I'm back at St. Anne's!
answer: St. Anne's?

question: Parochial school. Akron. St. Android's.
answer: You were unhappy?

question: I was expelled! When I was fifteen?
answer: The reason?

question: Beats me! What do you think? Smoking! Heavy petting, without a chaperone. Heavy petting, with the chaperone. And wearing a black bra, under my uniform. The demon bra.
answer: I see.

question: You see? You see? I have to get out of here I have to make a phone call. Don't you get it? I'm in a convent! You're a nun!
answer: Sit down.

question: What?
answer: Sit. Miss Van Cartier.

question: What?
answer: Your cigarette -- out. It has come to pass.

question: What?
answer: I joined this convent some thirty years ago. At that time, the world knew some measure of peace. And hope. Our order was a beacon of hospitality, to families, to children, to a neighborhood filled with promise. And, as the years have passed, I have watched that promise destroyed. Drugs. Gangs. Spandex. And. so I have made this convent an oasis, a retreat from horror. And now that horror has invaded these sacred walls.

question: Are you talking about me?
answer: And all those like you.

question: You mean black people?
answer: Absolutely not. I mean the wicked. The heedless. And their Las Vegas concubines.

question: What's a concubine?
answer: Check your driver's license.

question: Fine. Got it. Look, the way I see it, I'm stuck here, right? I mean, I'm here or I'm target practice. So here's the deal -- I don't bug you, you don't bug me. I'll catch up on some sleep, watch some tube, lay back and lay low. So just get me a key and show me to my room, and do not disturb. Capisce?
answer: Of course. But it's almost lunch.

question: Cool. Is there a menu? Or buffet?
answer: Before we do, you might like to freshen up. And you'll certainly want to change

question: Deal. How about a robe? One of those big terry cloth jobs, with like embroidery on the pocket. "Guest of St. Katherine's"
answer: Would you like that?

question: You should hand-wash that blouse, and send somebody out for some things. I look good in reds, purples, hot pink -- and shoes. Five-inch heels. Fuck-me pumps. Oh, man -- sorry. 'Scuse my mouth.
answer: Excused. Open the cabinet to your left. You will find appropriate attire.

question: No! No! I can't do this!
answer: Normally dressed, you are a sore thumb, and you endanger us all. While you are here, you will conduct yourself as a nun. Only I shall know who, and what, you truly are. You will not disrupt the convent. You will not influence the Sisters with your colorful street talk. You will draw no attention to yourself in any way.

question: But look at rites Look at this! I'm a nun! I'm invisible! I'm a penguin!
answer: As of now, and until you leave, you are Sister Mary Clarence.

question: Mary Clarence? Like a guy? Like a dumb guy?
answer: The Mary is in deference to the Holy Mother, the Clarence in honor of Saint Clarence Loyola. There are three vows that every nun must accept. The vow of poverty...

question: No problem.
answer: The vow of obedience.

question: Like to who?
answer: And the vow of chastity.

question: I'm outta here.
answer: Good afternoon, Sisters. I apologize for my tardiness. I would like you to welcome a new member of our order, Sister Mary Clarence. Mary Clarence comes to us from a somewhat more progressive convent. She is eager for a more disciplined life, and will make every effort to conform to our ways. Yes, Mary Patrick?

question: Very well. Mary Clarence, rise please.
answer: A blessing? Like, for lunch? For what we are about to receive... may the Lord... prepare us and... watch us and... walk through the valley and be our shepherd and... to the republic for which it stands... God bless us every one, hallowed be thy name. Hallelujah. Ave Maria. Boyardee. Amen.

question: Sisters, for the rest of the day we shall declare a Vow of Silence.
answer: A what?

question: Surely you are familiar with this practice, Mary Clarence. Only when our lips are silent, can our prayers truly be heard.
answer: Silence? No talking? All day?

question: Until sundown.
answer: Oh my God.

question: And Mary Clarence? As a new member of our order, I think you might also enjoy a ritual fast.
answer: A what?

question: A fast. To remind us of the poor, of those who must endure without enough to eat.
answer: No food?

question: Is this all the food I get?
answer: Yes. Until breakfast.

question: That's tomorrow! Don't you have any snacks? Machines?
answer: This shall be your cell, Mary Clarence.

question: My what?
answer: Your cell. Your room.

question: You were right the first time. Is this like, solitary? The cooler? Where's the furniture?
answer: Our lives are simple. We have little need for material possessions.

question: Right, sure thing. But what about, like, appliances? Like a little color portable? Boom box?
answer: Useless distractions.

question: It's like the Stone Age. The room time forgot. What about a phone?
answer: And whom would you call?

question: Oh, I don't know... Satan?
answer: Your cell is more than adequate.

question: Right. So what do we do now? Ping- Pong? Row over to the monastery?
answer: It is nine p.m. Pleasant dreams.

question: Wait. No. You're kidding. Lights out? At nine? My day's just starting.
answer: I'm sure. If I were you, I would use this time, to think about my life. And its direction. Or lack thereof.

question: What's wrong with my life?
answer: From all I've heard, just about everything. Your singing career seems all but nonexistent, and your married lover wants you dead. If you're fooling anyone, it's only yourself. God has brought you here. Take the hint.

question: What?
answer: Come on, we're late.

question: What? What time is it?
answer: It's after five. We have to bathe.

question: Which convent? It was, um, the Little Sisters... of the Moonlight. In Vegas. Everybody used to come to Mass. Frank. Dean. Sammy. Right at ringside.
answer: Enough jabber.

question: What?
answer: Progressive convents. Vanity. It sounds awful. It sounds just like this place.

question: Like this place?
answer: I like my old convent, in Vancouver. Out in the woods. It wasn't all modern, like here. No electricity. Cold water. Bare feet. Those were nuns. It was Hell on earth, but I loved it. This place is a Hilton.

question: Jesus. Data-base hoods. It's a wonderful world. Beloved daughter missing. Reward of two hundred and fifty thousand dollars. Please find our adored angel, we miss her so. Dead or alive.
answer: Vince is getting desperate. Where is she, Eddie? Where'd you stash her?

question: Where's who?
answer: You won't even tell us?

question: I need to see you, at once. Girls, please excuse Sister Mary Patrick for a few moments. Mary Clarence?
answer: Yeah?

question: Girls, this is Sister Mary Clarence. She'll be minding you until Sister Mary Patrick's return. Mary Clarence, please assign a biblical passage. Do not attempt discussion. Am I understood?
answer: I got it.

question: Come, Sister.
answer: So, hi there. I'm... Sister Mary Clarence. And you're... young Christians. I guess I should assign you this passage. What's good? What were you talking about?

question: So, hi there. I'm... Sister Mary Clarence. And you're... young Christians. I guess I should assign you this passage. What's good? What were you talking about?
answer: We were talking about the wild thing. Teen promiscuity.

question: Really. Well... yes. Yes it is.
answer: How come? Sister?

question: Well... because it's in the Bible. "Thou shalt not..." Thou shalt not. Excuse me -- just what are you all doing here? At Sunday School?
answer: 'Cause we love it so damn much. And cause we gotta come here. Probation.

question: Probation? Yeah, you learned a whole lot, I can tell.
answer: Well, what would you know about it, anyway? What do any of you nunheads know about anything? About doin' the nasty, or gettin' high?

question: Shut up! Okay, so maybe I'm a nun -- so, you want to ask me something? You want to listen, for once in your little lives? You want to pay some attention? I said I was a nun, not an asshole.
answer: Well, what about the sex stuff? What if some dude is after you, and he's always saying stuff, commin' on sweet and mellow. Like, oh, baby, you know you'll love it. Oh, baby, if you loved me, you'd stay.

question: And you listen to that?
answer: No, but... I don't know... sometimes.

question: Hey, I know, it's hard. But do what I do.
answer: What you do?

question: Just tell him, I do love you, but I can't -- I'm a nun. Deal with it, sweet thing. It's important, nowadays. You just practice at home, with a balloon and a banana. Because a banana is part of a balanced breakfast. And don't forget fiber.
answer: A balloon and a banana! Tell me, Mary Clarence, what were you thinking?

question: Those girls were asking questions. They've got it rough. I wish somebody had talked to me about that stuff when was their age. I wish somebody would talk to me about it now.
answer: This is a convent, not a clinic. We offer moral guidance, not hardware.

question: Have you been out in those streets? Do you know what those kids are up against? You should help them!
answer: We are nuns. We seek solutions through prayer.

question: Sometimes it's not enough!
answer: You are correct. Sometimes prayer alone cannot help a situation. Such as your own, for example. How do you feel about physical labor?

question: It never solves anything.
answer: Do your recall the words of Saint Peter, in Ecciesiastes 1:27? He spoke unto a wastrel youth. He said, "Take up thy task, and know ye the path of contentment."

question: In English?
answer: How to put it... ah, Of course, Mary Clarence. "No pain, no gain."

question: The minute I saw you. I said to myself, she's a weaver. Have you ever used a loom?
answer: Not in years.

question: Well, it all comes back, in just a jiffy. I'm working on a wall-hanging, of the convent.
answer: Why?

question: To sell, of course. I hate to say it, but we're in terrible trouble here at St. Katherine's. We need a new roof, the furnace is going, and there's no money.
answer: But don't you get money? From the Vatican?

question: Mary Clarence. Goose. We're completely self-supporting. Like all convents. Like yours.
answer: Oh, right. At my old place, we used to... wash cars. Groom dogs. So... nice loom.

question: Isn't it lovely? Now I'll demonstrate, and then you can hop right in. You just draw your beater in, keep it pressed against the pick, and open the shed. Then pass your shuttle, beat, and open the next shed. Shuttle. beat, beat, shuttle, beat, shed. Keep tension on the warp. Is that clear?
answer: Just about. Show me again.

question: You betcha. Shuttle, beat, shed. And watch your heddles.
answer: I love my heddles. Show me again.

question: Look, this isn't my kind of thing! I wasn't cut out to make little tapestries, or knit little sweaters! I don't do that! I'm a star! Let me talk to Detective Eddie Mulcahy. It's an emergency. Real bad. Eddie, you've got to get me out of here.
answer: Not again. You can't keep calling. Somebody's going to catch on to where you are.

question: But I'm going insane! All these people do is pray and work, work and pray! I don't get it -- when's the weekend? They have gruel, Eddie, that's what they call food! Gruel -- it's like Alpo for nuns! I sleep in a cell, on a board, and I pray five times a days Do you know what I pray for, Eddie, do you have any idea? Check your crotch, Eddie --anything fall off yet? Get me outta her!
answer: Calm down. Look, I didn't want to tell you this, but we've had some problems with our protection program lately.

question: Like what?
answer: Keeping our witnesses alive. We hide them, but there's a leak in the department, and they end up dead.

question: You son-of-a-bitch!
answer: I just need a few more weeks,

question: But it's a nightmare! Mother Superior is out to get me! She hates my guts! She keeps thinking up new kinds of torture! Do you hear that? That choir? Eddie, in here, that's what they call music!
answer: Don't call again. It's not safe. I'll be in touch.

question: Yeah? What? What does she want now? I did the dishes. I oiled the pews. I dusted the hymnals. Two hundred hymnals. Why can't people share? What?
answer: I... I brought you something.

question: A cigarette?
answer: An extra heel of bread. Please take it, you need your strength. You've been working so hard.

question: Thanks. So which one are you? Sister Bruce? Sister Doug?
answer: Mary Robert. I'm... Mary Robert.

question: Right. Okay. Bob. Nice to know you. So, Bob, how long have you been in? St. K's?
answer: Three years. Sister.

question: Three years. A rookie.
answer: A novice.

question: Yeah, like a learner's permit, right? When do you hit the big time? You know, when do you take the final vows? Whoa! Bob! What's going on here? What'd I say?
answer: You have to help me

question: Right, sure, but what's the problem? Are they keeping you a prisoner here? Do they drug you? Did Reverend Mother like, kidnap your parents? We can call the Enquirer.
answer: No, you don't understand -- I don't want to get out! I want to get in?

question: Excuse me?
answer: Oh. Mary Clarence, I'm so unworthy. I want to take my final vows, I would do it tomorrow, but Reverend Mother won't let me!

question: She won't? Why not?
answer: She says I should wait. She says that no one should become a nun as an escape from life. She says that I'm not experienced enough to make the decision yet. In a mature manner.

question: She said that? Reverend Mother? Well, then there's only one thing to do.
answer: What?

question: Reverend Mother says you need experience, right, in life. In order to make a responsible decision. This is going to be very painful for me. You know how much I love this little room. This whole convent. Wait. Must I do this thing, 0 Lord? Please help me.,. yes, I know... I must put my selfish cares aside... I must think of others... yes, she's here... He says hi... yes, I understand... let thy will be done. Amen. You too. We must do this sacred thing, Mary Robert.
answer: Of course! We must do it! It's the will of God! What is it?

question: We must... get you some experience. We must... leave this place.
answer: Are you sure?

question: We hear you.
answer: Are you sure this is what Reverend Mother had in mind?

question: I know it is. It's life. Experience. Take a deep breath.
answer: Mary Clarence!

question: You know it.
answer: We need experience.

question: It's part of St. Katherine's new community outreach program. How old are you? You shouldn't be smoking. Have you ever seen a diseased lung? Hand 'em over. And you, with the devil's brew passing through your lips. A mind is a terrible thing to waste. Bobs
answer: Experience! Right?

question: Right. A couple of bowls of chili. And another round of these.
answer: I have to do this. So I can become a nun.

question: Initiation. You understand. Later on, we make her wear her underwear on her head.
answer: Really?

question: And she wants to be a nun.
answer: Who are all these people?

question: This is your neighborhood. Your turf. You should get to know 'em. Better now. Time off. For bad behavior.
answer: I am.

question: Bob! What're you doing?
answer: I'm getting experience.

question: You watch yourself!
answer: Those people are wonderful! Why don't we ever see them in church?

question: Good point. Especially that dude you were with. I'd like to see him down front.
answer: Mary Clarence! You're so... different from the other sisters. Sometimes, well... sometimes you sound more like a layperson.

question: Honey.
answer: I can't wait to tell Reverend Mother about all my experiences. I've learned so much.

question: Well, you know, you don't have to tell her everything. I mean, nothing really happened. We just... took a walk. Run!
answer: Mary Clarence!

question: Keep moving! Climb! Now! Goddamn it!
answer: Mary Clarence! Oh my Lord!

question: Experience!
answer: What was all that? Who was that man? Why would he shoot at us?

question: I don't know, some people just don't like nuns. I wish I had a ruler.
answer: We could have been killed! But you saved me! Thank you, Mary Clarence!

question: What'd she say?
answer: You blew it -- big time. She doesn't want you back.

question: Does she know people are trying to kill me out there?
answer: She's counting on it. She's concerned for your safety, but she wants me to try and find another convent that will take you. Or a carnival.

question: So what am I supposed to do in the meantime?
answer: Go in and talk to her. It can't hurt. Go.

question: So... hi there.
answer: I don't believe we have anything to say to each other.

question: Look... I know I shouldn't have, I'm incredibly sorry about Mary Robert, I wasn't thinking, I didn't know that would happen!
answer: Mary Robert's life was in danger! Your behavior was inexcusable!

question: I know! I'm sorry I didn't mean for it to happen! And I was the one they were shooting at!
answer: Mary Clarence, I have given you every opportunity. To change. To make a decent life for yourself.

question: A decent life? Excuse me? As what? A janitor?
answer: Clearly, you have learned nothing. And you present an ongoing threat, both to this convent and to yourself.

question: But you can't kick me out! Guys want to kill me! You're a nun! A big nun! Aren't you supposed to have compassion? For the wayward sheep? I mean, I'm a major sinner! All-time great! Hall of Fame! Aren't I, like, your dream come true? Your Olympic event?
answer: Mary Clarence, perhaps you are correct.

question: I am?
answer: You may stay. But I shall restrict your activities to but a single task.

question: What?
answer: You have, I believe, some minimal background in music. Therefore, you are to join our choir. You will sing, and you will sleep,' that is your schedule until you depart. As almost no one attends Mass, you will be unable to cause further damage.

question: No. No.
answer: You're my Olympic event.

question: Not the choir, please, anything but that. The choir -- I mean, have you heard them? I'll do anything, scrub floors, toilets, you name it, but not that I
answer: The choir, Mary Clarence. Go for the gold.

question: We're looking for Mike.
answer: You found him -- but we're not open yet. Hey -- the till's empty!

question: I'm sorry -- I don't know what gets into him.
answer: Who are you guys?

question: We're the guys from Vegas. You had Christy last night, but you let her get away. It's upsetting.
answer: But you didn't tell me!

question: We didn't tell you what?
answer: That she's a nun! That chick you're looking for -- she's a nun!

question: Sure. Kind of... free-lance.
answer: Free-lance? Oh really? You think I don't see? You think I took vows yesterday? I know what you're up to. You and Reverend Mother.

question: What?
answer: You're a ringer. She brought you in to replace me. Out with the old.

question: Mary Robert.
answer: What?

question: Mary Robert, I've watched you. You never really sing. You whisper. Nothing comes out.
answer: I don't want to mess anyone up...

question: Give me a C. A C! Louder! Like you're onstage. Like people are eating, and there's silverware, and you want them to hear you. Think about that guy you were dancing with!
answer: Oh my!

question: Yeah, for one second. That was the blend -- you've got to listen to each other. Be a group.
answer: I knew that.

question: Mary Lazarus, I get the feeling that you like discipline. Hard work.
answer: Of course. I'm a nun. Four Popes now. The Lord hates a loafer.

question: Ten-hut! That machine.
answer: I know. It's ancient.

question: It's a rhythm section. The beat. Mary Patrick -- do you remember the Dixie Cups?
answer: The Dixie Cups? Oh my. I was just a girl. Of course.

question: Hold it. Mary Patrick, you're a pretty cheerful person, aren't you?
answer: Am I? All right, I am, I know it! All my life, I've just been... upbeat. Optimistic. Perky. I can't help it. Even when I was little, I remember my mother used to say, "That child is pure sunshine. She'll either be a nun -- or a stewardess."

question: So use it. When we sing hymns, they're usually about rejoicing, right? Celebration. Most music is. So don't hold back. Let all that joy go right into your voice. Make me happy. Let me hear it. Perk out. Perk down. Because we're
answer: GOING TO THE CHAPEL OF LOVE!

question: You know what we're saying! I think they hear you!
answer: Gospel. A jazz solo on the organ. What next? Jesus goes to Rio? Good Friday-a- go-go? What were you thinking?

question: I was thinking Las Vegas. Get some butts in those seats.
answer: And what next? Popcorn? Curtain calls? This is not a theater. or a casino.

question: Exactly. People like going to theaters and casinos. But they think church is for Grandma -- we could change that. Pack the joint.
answer: Through blasphemy? You have corrupted the entire choir!

question: Hold on. That's not fair. I worked hard with them. They gave up their free time, and they loved it. Those women are happy. And we can get even better. We can wake this place up.
answer: Out of the question.

question: Please let me try. I'm begging you.
answer: And I am refusing. As of tomorrow, Mary Lazarus will resume her leadership of the choir.

question: And I am refusing. As of tomorrow, Mary Lazarus will resume her leadership of the choir.
answer: Reverend Mother, I just wanted to congratulate you.

question: Oh?
answer: I haven't enjoyed Mass this much in years. What a marvelous program. Innovative. Inspiring. You are to be commended.

question: Well... thank you.
answer: I can't wait until next Sunday, when the choir performs again. Did you see the people walk right in from the street? That music, that heavenly music -- it called to them.

question: Perhaps.
answer: I must tell the Cardinal. I.11 send him a personal letter, describing your efforts, your bold new fight to keep your little convent alive.

question: DIG DOWN DEEP, GIVE ALL YOU CAN TRUST ME, CHILDREN, THERE'S A HEAVENLY PLAN!
answer: Don't look at your feet, and I don't want to see anybody counting. Make it look easy. Again!

question: Right, right, cross with the left, spin and turn!
answer: Hopeless I

question: Amateurs 2
answer: Babies

question: Again!
answer: We're here to pray for you, brother. We know you don't want to sell drugs. You just had an unhappy childhood, and maybe a learning disability. You just need someone to pray for you.

question: Eddie! You scared the hell out of me!
answer: What if I was Vince? You'd be dead right now. What are you doing giving interviews on TV?

question: It wasn't my fault! They just showed up. It's helping the convent.
answer: You're supposed to be hiding out!

question: I really can't talk about it now. The place is packed. SRO. I've got a show to do.
answer: Listen to yourself. This isn't a career opportunity.

question: I know that. This isn't about me. It's about the choir. You should hear them. They're good. Really good. And I taught them.
answer: Jesus, look at you You're glowing.

question: I am?
answer: Yeah. You look... great. I mean it..

question: Really? Lieutenant?
answer: I've been worried about you.

question: You mean -- worried about my testimony?
answer: No -- worried about you. Personally.

question: Well.. thanks. I've been thinking about you.. - sometimes. I mean, there aren't a lot of guys around here. I mean, sometimes I feel like... a nun.
answer: Me too.

question: You're not... seeing anybody?
answer: No. Most of the time I'm thinking about you. And now... you've really changed.

question: I have?
answer: You re sort of... radiant. your eyes are shining. You're rea1ly different... You're... you're a nun.

question: We're in a convent! I've got to go.
answer: Just remember - you're a target. Don't you think Vince has a T.V.?

question: Isn't that why we were asked to sing for those Cardinals?
answer: I believe this can be settled by a simple vote.

question: A vote?
answer: Of course. Mary Clarence, a convent is not a totalitarian state. Most major decisions are made by the membership as a whole. A membership that, I am certain, will vote in a rational and pious manner. All those in favor of allowing Mary Clarence to select a program?

question: But... wait a minute...
answer: The majority has spoken.

question: What?
answer: I am certain the presentation will be a great success. Congratulations, Mary Clarence. And congratulations to you all.

question: You sent for me?
answer: You have a phone call.

question: Hello? That soon? Great. That's good to hear. Right, right -- thanks. Hey -- your prayers have been answered. I'm leaving. In just a couple of days.
answer: Really. Well, that makes two of us.

question: What?
answer: I have submitted my resignation to Bishop O'Hara. Privately. I have asked to be relocated as soon as possible.

question: But -- why?
answer: I must go where I can be of use.

question: But -- there's so much more to do right here. And look, if it's about me, I mean, I'm gone.
answer: Indeed. After how long? A few weeks? I have been here thirty years. And yet, it would seem, I know nothing.

question: But everything that's happening is good! You can be a part of it!
answer: A part of what? Mary Clarence, it is one thing to rabble rouse, to sweep into town and declare a holiday. You have raised the Sisters' expectations, you have excited and confused them. They imagine this neighborhood to be some sort of delightful ongoing block party. You and I know that life is not so simple. There will be disappointments. Rude shocks. And you will have vanished. How... fortunate.

question: Okay, so I just got things started. But you could build on that. You could keep it going.
answer: I am sorry, Mary Clarence. I seem to have misplaced my tambourine. Good day, Mary Clarence.

question: But...
answer: Good day.

question: Get moving. I'm right behind you. Eddie...?
answer: Vince knows you're here.

question: How?
answer: Long story. His goons will be here any minute. We've got to get you out of here '- now!

question: I can't go with you.
answer: What?

question: I've got a show -- at St. Matthew's Cathedral. We're singing for the Cardinals.
answer: You're gonna be singing for St. Peter if you don't get your ass out of here!

question: Mary Clarence! Sister!
answer: It's no use. She just isn't here.

question: It doesn't make any sense. She was right behind me...
answer: We can't sing without her! What should we do?

question: Eddie -- I've got to go back. They won't sing without me. I'm deserting them.
answer: I think they'd understand.

question: That's not the point! They need me!
answer: They need you? A bunch of nuns? For what? Moral guidance? Make-up tips?

question: You don't get it! It's a big thing for them, it's like... Caesar's Palace. Prime-time. They're singing for the Cardinals. It's like... "Star Search." If first prize was a trip to the Vatican. They've worked really hard, they deserve this.
answer: Nuns?

question: She's got nothing to do with this. Let her go.
answer: Yeah, right to the cops. No way.

question: Mary Robert, don't panic. Remember what we talked about? Experience?
answer: What?

question: You can handle this. Go!
answer: She's gettin' away!

question: Can't help you. No exceptions.
answer: Young man!

question: What?
answer: We are nuns. We pray.

question: So?
answer: We pray for good things. Food for the hungry.

question: Yeah...
answer: Right. That way we'd never know which bullet got to her brain and killed her first. It could always be the other guy.

question: Okay, we got one-two-three, and on three we both shoot. Got it?
answer: Got it.

question: One... two... Three! You didn't shoot!
answer: Neither did you!

question: I figured if you were gonna, then I wouldn't have to.
answer: That's what I figured, too.

question: Find 'em!
answer: There!

question: No -- there!
answer: Over there!

question: Freeze! Everybody! Joey?
answer: Where is she?

question: I don't think so. What about skydiving? A crank call to Billy Graham?
answer: You have evidenced great maturity, Mary Robert. We shall have a serious discussion.

question: What about me, Reverend Mother? I think you were right. I'm just a bad influence. Sister show biz.
answer: Perhaps not. Perhaps we can all use... a little Spandex.

question: Really? And maybe shorter habits, and women priests, and sleeping late?
answer: Don't push it.

question: It's true!
answer: I WAS HELL-BOUND,

question: Don't you know it! What did He say?
answer: HE SAID, SING THE DEVIL AWAY!

question: Were you wicked?
answer: SING!

question: Were you tempted?
answer: SING! SING AND YOUR SPIRIT WILL SOAR!

question: But I'm fearful!
answer: SING!

question: And I'm tearful!
answer: SING!
